title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 04/26/2022 INC#0016

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0016; 01:25AM; 1120 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3BLaY3L; #Downtown; 103 LAFD Firefighters assigned in largely defensive operations, took 72 minutes to access, confine and extinguish heavy fire in a 150' x 60' combination one (rear) and two (front) story commercial building, the site of a previous burn. Firefighters prevented the fire from damaging adjacent commercial structures. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM22 E10 E13 E209 E210 E211 E215 E227 E266 E27 E4 E9 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA209 RA810 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T27 T66 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0016; 12:13AM; 1120 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3BLaY3L; #Downtown; 86 LAFD Firefighters assigned in defensive operations at a 150' x 60' combination one (rear) and two (front) story commercial building, the site of a previous burn. ; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM22 E10 E13 E209 E210 E211 E215 E227 E266 E27 E4 E9 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA209 RA810 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T27 T66 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Brush Fire; INC#1180; 04:56PM; 9505 W Hidden Valley Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3k9xwDC; Beverly Crest; KNOCKDOWN: Firefighters contained and extinguished the fire in 48 minutes, holding it to 1/4 acre. No residences were damaged. Firefighters will remain on scene to conduct for about 2 hours to conducted mop up operations and ensure no hot spots remain. Beverley Hills Fire (BHFD) Engine 2 and BC1 are also on scene. There are no injuries reported. The downed powerlines remain an electrical hazard and LA Dept of Water and Power will handle and are the agency for any questions regarding power restoration (it is unknown how many may be affected at this time). No further details. ; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart

Traffic; INC#1187; 04:42PM; 1060 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LbR5XC; Downtown; A collision (reported to be at the conclusion of a pursuit) occurred with three patients being transported: 2 LAPD officers and 1 civilian (age/gender unknown). None have any life-threatening injuries. Two additional patients (civilians) declined treatment/transport. No LAPD incident number available. The 9-1-1 call was received at 4:12PM. No further details.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E10 E209 EM11 RA10 RA11 RA17 RA20 RA46 RA810; CH4; 14; Margaret Stewart

Update Brush Fire; INC#1180; 04:35PM; 9505 W Hidden Valley Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3k9xwDC; Beverly Crest; Due to the downed, active powerlines limiting access, firefighters are having to find alternate routes to access the fire. 10 additional fire engines are responding to assist. This is a small fire (less than 1/8 acre) and is not a wind driven fire. There are no evacuations in place and no immediate threat to any residences. The primary concern is safely accesses the fire due to electrical hazard and prevent the fire from extending into the large (eucalyptus trees) LAFD Air Ops is on scene and has conducted a drop at the head of the fire. Drivers are requested to please avoid the area due to congestion with LAFD apparatus.; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 AO2 BC14 BC17 CM42 E102 E108 E109 E278 E290 E58 E71 E97 E99 EM14 H1 H3 H5 HA1 HA3 HA5 RA90 RA97 T78 T90; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart

Brush Fire; INC#1180; 04:08PM; 9505 W Hidden Valley Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3k9xwDC; Beverly Crest; Firefighters are on scene with approximately 1/4 acre of brush burning uphill (appears to have been caused by a tree falling on a powerline) with downed powerlines. Crews are working to anchor the fire while additional companies are routing to the topside. Beverly Hills Fire Department is also on scene. ; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC14 BC17 E102 E108 E278 E290 E58 E71 E97 E99 EM14 H0A H0D RA97 T78 T90; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart

Hiker Rescue - Hoist Operation; INC#0796; 12:08PM; 4090 N Reseda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/38FE9bz; Tarzana; LAFD Air Ops is conducting a hoist operation with transport for an approximately 56yo M patient with a suspected leg fracture. The 9-1-1 call was received at 12:08PM. No further details.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E293 E83 H1 H2 HA1 HA2 RA93 RH114 T93; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Rubbish Fire; INC#0429; 08:51AM; Wb Santa Monica Fy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LeU0Pj; Downtown; KNOCKDOWN: 83 firefighters extinguished the fire in one hour and 19 minutes with no injuries reported. The large amount of pallets stored under the freeway created a challenge in reaching the seat of the fire. Forklifts on scene were used to move the extinguished pallets so firefighters could continue to make their way in and fully extinguished the fire. CHP will handle the re-opening of the freeway, drivers are advised to check https://cad.chp.ca.gov/Traffic.aspx for updates. LAFD Arson is responding for a *possible* witness to the fire cause. No further details.; FS 17; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 E1 E14 E15 E17 E2 E201 E202 E203 E210 E211 E221 E25 E4 E9 EA1 EM1 RA17 RA25 T1 T10 T11 T2 T21 T3 T9; CH7; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Trapped Vehicle - FATALITY; INC#0460; 08:28AM; Eb 105 Fy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3rNbFWP; outside city; Three car collision (into Cal Trans truck) with one person determined deceased on scene (age/gender unknown at this time). There are no other injuries reported. All media queries regarding the collision are referred to CHP (incident number not available). The 9-1-1 call was received at 8:06AM. No further details.; FS 51; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District outside city; BC4 E205 E295 E51 E64 E67 EM9 HR3 RA51 RA95 T5 T95 UR88; CH7; 15; Margaret Stewart

Update Rubbish Fire; INC#0429; 08:14AM; Wb Santa Monica Fy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LeU0Pj; Downtown; With pallets stacked all the way from the ground to the freeway, there is a significant amount of fuel to burn. Firefighters made access to both sides of the freeway to use large diameter handlines/appliances. The amount of smoke created is causing a zero-visibility environment as firefighters continue to work their way in and make progress. The 10FWY remains closed and drivers are advised to plan alternate routes. There are now 83 firefighters assigned to this incident. The freeway itself is the primary exposure with some commercial buildings threatened but not currently exposed. No injuries reported. ; FS 17; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM22 E1 E14 E15 E17 E2 E201 E202 E203 E210 E211 E221 E25 E4 E9 EA1 EM1 RA17 T1 T10 T11 T2 T21 T3 T9; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart
